channel.title: This is annoying, wtf
channel.description:
OK, SO, HOW THE HELL DO I FIX TWITCHING NPC'S IVE DONE LIKE A BILLION THINGS TO FIX IT!! PLEASE HELP? JUST 1 EXPLANATION IS GOOD, TY, I KNOW THIS ISNT A SPOON FEEDING COMMUNITY, I JUST NEVER KNEW HOW TO FIX IT, AS FROM MY LAST POST OF THIS, NO ON REPLIED, THANKS
MY BASE IS DELTA, LOL

item.title: This is annoying, wtf
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

When I mean,

Repeat for all instances of that.
It means the same thing as: If you see the same thing in the NPCHandler class (im reffering to NPCHandler.java), then remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: This is annoying, wtf
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

[quote=“Project Evolution, post:4, topic:339402”]In the NPCHandler class find,

RebuildNPCList = true;

Look for it in the process() method found in the NPCHandler class, which should look like,

for (int j = 1; j < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; j++) { if (server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { server.playerHandler.players[j].RebuildNPCList = true; } }

Repeat for all instances of that.[/quote]
“repeat all instances of that?” im sorry, i just dont understand java very well, could u tell me what to repeat? lol
please dont rep-- me, im not saying u didnt explain it clearly, im just saying what i didnt understand
thanks

Read full topic

item.title: This is annoying, wtf
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

In the NPCHandler class find,

RebuildNPCList = true;

Look for it in the process() method found in the NPCHandler class, which should look like,

for (int j = 1; j < server.playerHandler.maxPlayers; j++) { if (server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { server.playerHandler.players[j].RebuildNPCList = true; } }

Repeat for all instances of that.

Read full topic
